title: Victorious skin is a marksman

embed.description: Hey all, last week we ran a survey where we asked players questions around how they would feel about adding chromas to victorious skins based on...

body:
Make your guesses here.

I reckon it's probably Kalista.

replies.body:
Well considering Victorious and Championship skins are usually champions that make a large impact in the season, it's a good bet that it will be Kalista.
I'd also put money on Sejuani for the Championship skin considering how it works.

Championship = early to mid season impact

Victorious = all round season dominance
Makes sense

Plot twist: It's Quinn.

EDIT: My god guys, learn to recognise obvious sarcasm...
\#ObviousSarcasmIsObvious

Except Quinn never gets played and thus can't have a significant impact on high elo and competitive play.
Especially for the majority of the season.

Only real possibilities are Kalista or Jinx. Most likely Kalista.
hi, while i don't like you i will offer my assistance and let you know that it won't be quinn.

> [{quoted}](name=ESP Azamalaza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=0j17bVrp,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-07-12T23:22:08.602+0000)
>
> hi, while i don't like you i will offer my assistance and let you know that it won't be quinn.

I thought you were banned or dead...how did you come back???
Because Rito wishes hell upon us, hence why bard and bard 2.0 (Tahm) exist.

Tahm is awesome though. Played around with him a bit with a friend, amazing teamwork potential in him.

ESP Amaduliamfnad though....
That would be really cool
We can dream.

Just like to bring this post up again. Proving I was right about it being sivir.. Thanks all. I feel pretty good about myself. Now just got to attempt to get gold. (You never know, pigs might just fly).

Still honestly surprised it's Sivir over kalista, considering that while sivir has had an impact, it's been more understated in the meta.

And good luck getting to gold.
Thanks mate. Will give it a go. Probably left it too late though.
SIVIR, its got to be Sivir.

If they say its a marksman, it wont be so obvious, it'll be someone like Azir or Teemo whose profiles state they are marksmen but really arent. 
(although it better not be Azir, I'm not gold and i refuse to miss out on a skin for him!)
Azir isn't a marksman, and this is the victorious skin, it won't be teemo.
Check Azir's profile, his secondary is marksman (quite why I'm not sure...), its just the kinda thing they'd try to pull to surprise us, but like i said they'd better not...

Maybe Azir being a marksman has to do with his passive and soldiers? It does increase his attack speed with CDR and he can attack from a range using his soldiers. By no means a "normal" marksman though.

i know he isn't an actual marksman, he is my main.
its confusing how they made it marksman instead of adc. in any case he isn't one but its the kind of curve ball they might try to throw.
Yeah i really don't understand why he is under marksmen as i didn't think he even was under that, but i doubt they would say it like that in this case.

Yea i don't know either, all it will do is confuse new players when they look at his profile and as they try to build him ADC and take him bot (which seeming that W would make your attacks LESS powerful when you use it, doesn't seem like the best idea xD) anyway i really hope you're right and they don't have it for him, ill be so sad if i miss out on a skin for him.
Victorious misfortune.

Ashe played a pretty major part in the first half of this year, going from underplayed to broken, then fixed back to viable.
Vayne was major in the Tank meta with a increase in play by almost 12% since the beginning of this year.
Kalista as mentioned would be very possible from the spike of popularity in competitive play.
Jinx would probably be the final candidate seeing how she was a monster throughout the game; great harass with scaling range and abilities well into the late game.
Others probably not so much...
Victorious Jinx or ashe.
